intro: Alstroemeria flava, commonly known as the golden alstroemeria, is a perennial flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with strap-like leaves that are dark green and glossy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its long-lasting blooms make it a favored ornamental plant in many regions.
